title: CryptSafe
author: CryptSafe
content: The current state of Nigeria education is very alarming. The educational sector needs revamp, the system is messed up, decaying and backward in every aspect. ASUU threatening strike, government yet to meet up with ASUU negotiation, no teachers and lecturer promotion for years, no salary increment. How do they want the teachers and lecturers to be comfortable teaching. Check out the last strike took almost 1year before it was called off. Reason the delay, time and frustration meted on students which is not proper hence students finding their way abroad to study making Nigeria to loose both manpower and resources to other nations of the world. And another thing is this, after finishing your higher education, getting a job is another prayer point waiting for answers. May God help us in this country.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: The Educational system in Nigeria is coin from the book called the Pedagogy of the Oppressed by Paulo Freire. Where banking education is giving to the scholars and liberal education is going to Europe. Nigerian education system is bad because the government is bad. The only time African leaders will realize themselves and restructure Africa is the only time they would decline world bank policies in the continent. Public and Private Partnership (PPP) is one of the policies that is killing African economy and this has made many governors to sacked their workers before they are trying to reduce the work force. UBA (Universal Basic Education) is one of the policies from World Bank. If a country want to develop then they should work on the Education system then other departments will be fine and okay. Asuu case can only be solved with and educated and committed leaders

comments.body: Truly educational system of nowadays is being compromised coupled with bad government. My question is, can the educational system still function very fine after we change governance or have good leaders?Most at times we tends to pour out everything to poor governance but deep insidely the students are also another major problems to be talking thereof. Why because we have lazy students who don't want to be useful to their lives rather wanting an easy way schooling without going through due process of academic. How can a class of 200 students only 100 active and yet missing 100 are found to be graduating with distinction and first class, even with upper credits while those who burn candles day and night reading manage to come out with 2nd class and Pass. Do we still blame government or bad leaders at this point?Please I would love some advance people to answer my question.
